Module com.example.JAVAdb
Package com.robertSchofield.JAVAdb.controller

Class customerController

java.lang.Object
com.robertSchofield.JAVAdb.controller.customerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class customerController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for the customer management functionality. It handles the actions related to adding, deleting, updating, and viewing customer data. It also populates the customer data in a TableView.

  • Method Details

    • actionCustAdd

      void actionCustAdd(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      This method is called when the "Add Customer" button is clicked. It navigates to the add customer page.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the button click.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the navigation.

    • actionCustDelete

      void actionCustDelete(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      This method is called when the "Delete Customer" button is clicked. It confirms the deletion of the selected customer and updates the TableView.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the button click.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the deletion or updating.

    • actionCustUpdate

      void actionCustUpdate(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      This method is called when the "Update Customer" button is clicked. It navigates to the update customer page for the selected customer.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the button click.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the navigation.

    • backToMenu

      void backToMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      This method is called when the "Back to Menu" button is clicked. It navigates back to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the button click.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the navigation.

    • buildData

      public void buildData() throws SQLException
      This method fetches customer data from the database and populates it in the TableView. It also dynamically creates table columns based on the customer class fields.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs during the database operation.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      This method is called when the customerController class is initialized. It calls the buildData method to populate the customer data in the TableView.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
